_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:45 using v2.7
title: How does nurse density per population compare internationally and how has it changed?
analysis_commentary: For the majority of countries reviewed there has also been an increase in nurse density per 1,000 people of the population. United Kingdom is the only country where there was a decrease in nurse density over the time period reviewed, with a drop from 9.0 nurses in 2000 to 8.3 nurses per 1,000 people in 2014. The United Kingdom was also below the OECD average in 2012 by 2.4 nurses per 1,000.
